timeline.message:
GH-2151 benchmarks and some required adjustments for robust benchmakrs

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

GH-2151 TPS benchmarks are more useful when they don't create a new native store for every measurement

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

GH-2155 make nioFileSize volatile just in case someone uses multiple threads to read and a single thread to write and some synchronization between

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

GH-2155 cache file size in DataFile

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

ignore some slow tests that don't run in maven anyway and are used to diagnose race conditions in the native store

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

ignore some slow tests that don't run in maven anyway and are used to diagnose race conditions in the native store

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

Merge branch 'develop' into GH-2155-cache-file-size

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

replies.bodyText: I created this to diagnose the previous race condition with multithreaded access to the NativeStore when using SERIALIZABLE transactions. The test never completes, since the purpose is to just bash the NativeStore until it crashes. The class doesn't have "Test" in it, so maven doesn't pick it up. And I'm getting a bit annoyed at running it by mistake when running all the NativeStore tests from IntelliJ. Should probably add some docs to the tests to explain why.
replies.author: hmottestad

timeline.message:
